posts.post_content:
Let it never be said that WoTC never printed a Human Merfolk, yes now you have one.   
  
Kidding aside this guy is decent. He is a solid 1/4 body, most blue creatures tend to be small in toughness and you never get to use them to block. This guy blocks centaurs then doubles the counters on your creatures. Heck, he even double counters on himself if he acquired any.   
  
My only gripe is I wish he were a wizard. He has two species classes Human Merfolk but they couldn't add Wizard to him as well? I guess they ran out of room on his text line. Its a shame he is human, being Merfolk would've been just fine.
posts.html:
Let it never be said that WoTC never printed a Human Merfolk, yes now you have one.

Kidding aside this guy is decent. He is a solid 1/4 body, most blue creatures tend to be small in toughness and you never get to use them to block. This guy blocks centaurs then doubles the counters on your creatures. Heck, he even double counters on himself if he acquired any.

My only gripe is I wish he were a wizard. He has two species classes Human Merfolk but they couldn't add Wizard to him as well? I guess they ran out of room on his text line. Its a shame he is human, being Merfolk would've been just fine.

posts.post_content:
Unless I'm mistaken, you could [Liquimetal Coating](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liquimetal Coating) a planeswalker into an artifact to make it targetable by Vorel?  
  
If you hit six mana with Vorel, and a Liquimetal Coating in play then you could play and instantly use [Ral Zarek](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ral Zarek)'s -7, or any other planeswalker.

posts.post_content:
I play a Vorel commander deck that gets out of control fairly often  
  
Among the best combo pieces:  
  
[Culling Dais](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Culling Dais): Allows you to draw *all* the cards after only saccing a single creature.  
  
Untap effects such as [Seeker of Skybreak](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seeker of Skybreak), [Fatestitcher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fatestitcher), and [Niblis of the Breath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niblis of the Breath) are all extremely powerful. While the Niblis costs mana, it also allows you to tap [Gilder Bairn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gilder Bairn) if you want to double the counters on a planeswalker or enchantment.  
  
[Seedborn Muse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seedborn Muse) is fantastic in commander games. Since you untap lands, it allows you to activate Vorel on every player's end step, or twice every end step with an untapper. It also lets you hold up counterspells while still spending all of your mana every turn, which is very valuable.  
[Murkfiend Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murkfiend Liege) is slightly worse for combo potential, but still buffs everything.  
  
[Plaxcaster Frogling](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Plaxcaster Frogling) come... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I play a Vorel commander deck that gets out of control fairly often

Among the best combo pieces:

Culling Dais: Allows you to draw all the cards after only saccing a single creature.

Untap effects such as Seeker of Skybreak, Fatestitcher, and Niblis of the Breath are all extremely powerful. While the Niblis costs mana, it also allows you to tap Gilder Bairn if you want to double the counters on a planeswalker or enchantment.

Seedborn Muse is fantastic in commander games. Since you untap lands, it allows you to activate Vorel on every player's end step, or twice every end step with an untapper. It also lets you hold up counterspells while still spending all of your mana every turn, which is very valuable.
Murkfiend Liege is slightly worse for combo potential, but still buffs everything.
